intro: Euryops annae, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which are typically surrounded by white ray florets. Euryops annae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
